business-card-about-me-general-list-item: Strong experience in Java, TypeScript, C#, Python, GitHub Actions, DevSecOps, Application Security.
Writing customer facing as well as internal documentation.
Creating pull requests and opening tickets to open source projects.
Developed and released <1>30+ GitHub Actions to the marketplace</1>.
Actively participating in StackOverflow and LeetCode discussions.
Planning features implementation and delivery them in time.
Experience in working with multiple teams and departments to integrate all development pieces together.
Experience in mentoring and teaching junior peers.
Solid knowledge and experience in backend, frontend, infrastructure, CI/CD development.
business-card-certificate-2: Parallel, Concurrent, and Distributed Programming in Java Specialization
business-card-certificate-3: The Complete React Developer Course (w/ Hooks and Redux)
business-card-certificate-4: Oracle Certified Associate, Java SE 8 Programmer
business-card-experience-job-arka-descri: I have started my professional career as a C# Developer using Silverlight. First half of a year I was fully involved into Silverlight development for customer from Germany. After the project has been finished I’ve been switched to full stack development of short-term web applications using PHP on backend and JavaScript on frontend. Last year I was working in parallel in 2 areas: company product development using Silverlight and short-term external web applications.
business-card-experience-job-arka-respon: Developing web applications using PHP and JavaScript.
business-card-experience-job-bitcoin-com: Work on cryptocurrency casino, mostly on monolith Administration web application for the casino - both frontend and backend layers.
Refactor and decrease technical debt on the project.
Introduce some tools and libraries that increased development productivity and decreased development time, such as Bootstrap for frontend layer, Lombok and other useful libraries for backend layer.
Redesign UI based on the Bootstrap UI components.
Keeping project healthy by upgrading dependencies and upgrading Java to the latest versions on a regular basis.
Increase unit tests code coverage from 0% to 80%.
Implement custom permissions mechanism that allows perform access control to specific features for specific administrators.
Heavily working on budget reporting (income from casino in crypto and fiat), players managing (reset password, sending bonuses, watch statistics), leaderboard, permissions features.
Restoring Android application with legacy code. Upgraded it to the latest version, redesigned and added additional features.

In addition to Administration web application I was working on casino web application and one of the valuable features in which I has been involved was connecting a big amount of games using API of a 3rd party organization that provides such service. Role of this organization is games aggregator that collects many games from different companies and provides all the games using unified API for casinos. On Feb 19, 2020 I moved from Games team to Data team and started working on Markets web application (backend project).
Configuring Travis CI for Administration web application.
Configuring GitHub Actions for casino web application.
Moving project from monolith to microservices.
Conducting technical interviews for external candidates.
Connecting 3rd party vendors of crypto rates to the Markets web application.
business-card-experience-job-lohika-1-de: I was working as off-shore contractor for Hewlett Packard Enterprise company, ALM Lab Management desktop application using C#, Windows Forms. Also, there was an administration desktop application written in Delphi where I did some fixes as well. I was growing here as a professional software engineer in a fully agile environment following well-structured business processes.
business-card-experience-job-lohika-1-re: Refactor and decrease technical debt on the project.
Working with different teams and departments, such as QA engineers, System Architects, designers and build managers.
business-card-experience-job-lohika-2-de: Still continue working for Hewlett Packard Enterprise but switching to different project and different tech stack. I was working on “Application Lifecycle Management" product on a backend side using Java. My backend/desktop development work was about 90/10. In 2015 almost half a year I was leading “ALM Robot” web application. Purpose of this application is to help to the users to upgrade their ALM projects to the latest versions.
business-card-experience-job-lohika-2-re: Leading "ALM Robot" web application written in Java and Angular.
business-card-experience-job-lohika-3-de: From Mar, 2017 till Mar, 2018 I was working as off-shore contractor for Prysm Inc. on Prysm iPhone application using C#, Xamarin. I work here in fully Agile environment. From May, 2018 till Sep, 2018 I was working as off-shore contractor for Earnin company in Microservices team. My backend/DevOps work was about 50/50. In parallel of my regular work I passed internal company's course named "Front-End Secondary Skills" and got "Frontend Developer" title in my profile.
business-card-experience-job-lohika-3-re: Working with different teams and departments, such as QA engineers, Project Manager, DevOps engineers and designers.
Configuring logging system in Kubernetes cluster using fluent bit, fluentd and EKS.
Developing iPhone application using C#, Xamarin.
Modifying chromium project to implement saving logged-in sessions to Redis to have possibility to share logged-in sessions between different chromium instances.
Conducting technical interviews for external candidates.
Conducting technical interviews for internal candidates on promotion.
Developing backend application using C#, .NET Core.
business-card-experience-job-wbyt-1-desc: Working in Arena Central team on Arena Central web application - both frontend and backend layers. The main idea of Arene is to give developers tools, so they can develop, build, test and deploy they applications to a vehicles. Arene Central web application shows builds statuses for the users’ projects that they develop to deploy to vehicles. I work on a project that is responsible for projects, applications, users, teams, organizations, those entities that are not relevant to CI related stuff, such as builds and runs.
business-card-experience-job-wbyt-1-resp: Leading Arene Central backend Java project.
Refactor and decrease technical debt on the project.
Keeping project healthy by upgrading dependencies (on both frontend and backend) and upgrading Java to the latest versions on a regular basis.
Redesigning and reorganizing project to keep scalability and easiness of development for a project.
Heavily working on CRUD features for applications, users, teams, projects entities.
business-card-experience-job-wbyt-2-desc: As a technical lead I was responsible for architectural decisions, have been involved into architectural discussions with other teams. Also, continue improving Arene Central web application. Started connecting another services to the application, such as Keycloak, AWS and Artifactory.
business-card-experience-job-wbyt-2-resp: Conducting technical interviews for external candidates.
Exposing project metrics to Prometheus and showing them in Grafana.
Implementing caching on a project layer for some heavy operations.
Connecting Keycloak to Java project for authentication and authorization purposes.
Writing user facing documentation as well as internal documentation.
Proposing to use integration tests on frontend project using cypress.
Proposing of dividing monolith to microservices.
business-card-experience-job-wbyt-2-titl: Software Engineer / Technical Lead, Arene Central
business-card-experience-job-wbyt-3-desc: Mostly worked on infrastructure and CI/CD layers. From infrastructure side we were using AWS and Terraform as IaC. For CI/CD we were using Concourse CI as a main CI/CD tool and GitLab CI for merge requests validations.
business-card-experience-job-wbyt-3-resp: Proposing to use load testing for our projects.
Connecting SAST tools to all maintained projects (around 40):
Security: snyk, tfsec, kubeval, checkov, gitleaks, detect-secrets.
Linters: tflint, markdownlint, yamllint, eslint, hadolint
Configuring GitLab CI for all projects to run pre-commit checks on every merge request.
Fixing and maintaining Concourse CI pipelines.
Configuring Harbor and Kong services using IaC approach with Terraform in AWS.
Performing Sprint planning and Sprint reviews.
business-card-experience-job-wbyt-3-titl: Senior Software Engineer / Technical Lead, Arene Central
business-card-experience-job-wbyt-4-desc: At that moment Arena Central team expanded enough to be divided into smaller teams, so as a result there were created 3 sub-teams and I’ve been promoted to team lead position to manage one of those sub-teams - Arene Central Services. People management requires additional work such as preparing 1 on 1, more meetings, etc., so technical/manager work became 40/60. Also, focus of the product has been slightly changed from the previous mode to integration mode. After this all Arene Tools teams started working more closely to integrate all pieces together. I was leading migration users from internal system to GitHub Actions. During that time I increased team by hiring 3 more engineers.
business-card-experience-job-wbyt-4-resp: Conducting manager interviews for external candidates.
Working closely with different stakeholders from different departments.
Showing demos with the implemented work.
Leading migration users to GitHub Actions, i.e. creating custom GitHub Actions, preparing self-hosted runners, writing migration documentation, working closely with teams to help them to migrate.
Proposing and leading backend deprecation API strategy.
Performing 1 on 1 meetings with direct reports.
Performing workshops for different topics, such as Java and GitHub Actions.
Planning features and strategy together with Product Manager and other stakeholders.
Hiring new engineers to increase the team from 3 to 6 members.
business-card-experience-job-wbyt-5-desc: Due to re-org a new Online Services team has been created by merging Arene Central and Arene OTA teams. As a result after 8 months of working as a team lead in Arene Central I switched to the same role to Online Services team. I was leading authentication & authorization (Auth) area starting from defining business requirements and ending by implementation and delivery of the 1st release.
business-card-experience-job-wbyt-5-resp: Working closely with other teams to collect the requirements about Auth.
Improving team's internal processes by defining some standardization guidelines.
Performing 1 on 1 meetings with direct reports.
Planning features and strategy together with manager.
business-card-experience-job-wbyt-6-desc: Moved to Application Security, SAST team to build and maintain SAST services that are used by all other teams within the company.
business-card-experience-job-wbyt-6-resp: Building backend services for remote SAST code analyzing
Implementing, maintaining and support of Application Security GitHub Actions.
Fixing bugs in GitHub Actions and SAST related tools that team owns.
